str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

word: we want you to know about
parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To make known, declare, know, discover. From a derivative of ginosko; to make known; subjectively, to know.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
(Hebrew), Macedonia, a Roman province north of Achaia (Greece). From Makedon; Macedonia, a region of Greece.
